intro: Sloanea caudata, commonly known as the velvetleaf sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. Sloanea caudata produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in short inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
